data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Having an abundance of something; abounding.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Plentiful; present in great quantity; fully sufficient: as, an abundant supply.
Possessing in great quantity; copiously supplied; having great plenty; abounding: followed by in.
Fully sufficient; plentiful; in copious supply; -- followed by <ex>in</ex>, rarely by <ex>with</ex>.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: a number, the sum of whose aliquot parts exceeds the number itself. Thus, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, the aliquot parts of 12, make the number 16. This is opposed to a <contr>deficient</contr> number, as 14, whose aliquot parts are 1, 2, 7, the sum of which is 10; and to a <contr>perfect</contr> number, which is equal to the sum of its aliquot parts, as 6, whose aliquot parts are 1, 2., 3.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.
